oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tom Ludwig's Kodak Diary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tom Ludwig's diary of his activities in Kodak, Tennessee. He gives his opinion on the development of local union leaders and participation in the meeting. He lists women participating as a benchmark for measuring success of these meetings, noting "now they get up and speak their piece about the tobacco allotment or anything else." He also mentions the potential for a song festival "using Zilphia's techniques."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ludwig, Tom
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Labor unions--Organizing--United States; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); AFL-CIO; Farmers Union (U.S.); Tobacco farms; Tobacco farmers; Women political activist; Fieldwork; Leadership
